definition:
Factorials raised to the power of themselves are called ultrafactorials.
The first few ultrafactorials are 1, 1, 4, 46656 ... (Sequence A046882
of OEIS). According to the website cnki.com, functions like
ultrafactorial and duplicate exponents are used to rectify the
systematic errors in increasing load forecasting by linear regression.
Hence they are helpful in forecasting annual electricity. Similarly
ultraprimorials can also be defined as primorials raised to the power of
themselves. The first few ultraprimorials 1, 4, 46656, ... (Sequence
A165812 of OEIS).
